revisions.rev:
{{Infobox Network | network_name = MTV Asia LDC | network_logo = [[Image:MTV_Logo_2010.svg|150px|MTV Logo]] | branding = MTV Asia | country = [[Singapore]] | network_type = [[Cable television|cable]] [[television network]] | slogan = | available = [[Asia]] | owner = [[Viacom]] | launch_date = 1 January 1994 | founder = | key_people = | website = [http://www.mtvasia.com www.mtvasia.com] }}
'''MTV Networks Asia Pacific''' comprises three distinctly branded television channels, [[MTV]], [[Nickelodeon South East Asia|Nickelodeon]] and [[VH1]] in the [[Asia Pacific region]] reaching more than 300 million households. Since its inception in 1 January 1994, MTV Networks Asia Pacific has been providing localized channels for young audiences across Asia and Australia. Initially established as two MTV channels (MTV Asia and MTV Mandarin), MTV Networks businesses have crossed the continent and every delivery platform by catering to audiences with localized programming in eight different languages across ten MTV channels, eight Nickelodeon channels, four VH1 channels and numerous branded programming blocks across the Asia-Pacific region. The companyâs localization initiatives were pioneering and its rapid growth in Asia significantly contributed to MTV becoming the worldâs largest television network.
MTV Networks Asia Pacific comprises 17 websites and 21 channels which are seen via 24-hour and programming blocks in various parts of Asia. Unlike the European and Latin American divisions, which are regulated by the headquarters' country main regulating body, the MTV Networks Asia channels are regulated by the individual country's regulation body.
==Divisions== * MTV Networks Australia & New Zealand - Managing Director - Dave Sibley & Katrina Southon (SVP) and David Lynn, EVP & MD, MTV Networks UK, Ireland, Australia & New Zealand. * MTV Networks India - Managing Director - Amit Jain * MTV Networks Pakistan - Managing Director - Ghazanffar Ali

*MTV:[[MTV Arabia|Arabia]], [[MTV China|China]], [[MTV India|India]], [[MTV Indonesia|Indonesia]], [[MTV Japan|Japan]], [[MTV Korea|Korea]], [[MTV Pakistan|Pakistan]], [[MTV Southeast Asia|Southeast Asia]], [[MTV Taiwan|Taiwan]], [[MTV Thailand|Thailand]], [[MTV Vietnam|Vietnam]]. *VH1:[[VH1 India|India]], [[VH1 Indonesia|Indonesia]], [[VH1 Pakistan|Pakistan]], Thailand. *Nickelodeon:[[Nickelodeon Arabia|Arabia]], [[Nickelodeon India|India]], [[Nickelodeon (Japan)|Japan]], [[Nickelodeon (Korea)|Korea]], [[Nickelodeon Pakistan|Pakistan]], [[Nickelodeon (Philippines)|Philippines]], [[Nickelodeon South East Asia|Southeast Asia]] *Nick Jr:[[Nick Jr|Southeast Asia]]
==Channels operated by MTV Networks Australia and New Zealand==
<gallery> Image:Nickelodeon logo new.svg|[[Nickelodeon (Australia)|Nickelodeon Australia & New Zealand]](Joint venture with [[XYZnetworks]]) Image:Nick Jr. logo 2009.svg|[[Nick Jr. (Australia)|Nick Jr. Australia and New Zealand]] (Joint venture with [[XYZnetworks]]) </gallery> *MTV: [[MTV Australia]], [[MTV Classic Australia]], [[MTV Hits Australia]] (Australia only), and [[MTV Live HD]] (Australia only) *Nickelodeon: [[Nickelodeon (Australia)]] and [[Nick Jr. (Australia)]] *Comedy Central: [[Comedy Central (New Zealand)]] (New Zealand only)
